qas.question: What was the name given to old Boston families?
Who came to be known as the nation's social elites?
Boston was admired for what kind of life?
Boston improved culturally because of its generous what?

context: During this period Boston flourished culturally as well, admired for its rarefied <a2_0>literary life<a2_0/> and generous <a3_0>artistic patronage<a3_0/>, with members of old Boston families—eventually dubbed <a0_0><a1_0>Boston Brahmins<a1_0/><a0_0/>—coming to be regarded as the nation's social and cultural elites.
